subject: Career
title: Internal Equity: What Peers Earn
description: A quick, practical guide to Internal Equity: What Peers Earn.

hook.text: You discover a colleague with the same title earns 20% more. Suddenly, your salary feels unfair.

buildup.text: Internal equity means fair pay among employees doing similar work. Many companies fail at it.

discovery.text: Pay compression happens when new hires get market rates while tenured employees stagnate.

twist.text: Companies fear the domino effect â€” fix one salary and everyone else asks. So they avoid it.

climax.text: Bringing market data and peer comparisons to a raise conversation is more effective than emotions.

punchline.text: Fairness doesn't fix itself. You have to ask.

quiz.question: What is pay compression?
options: New hires earning as much as tenured employees
